intro: Bennettiodendron simaoense, commonly known as the Simao bennettiodendron, is a rare and endemic species native to the Yunnan province in China. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its unique, woody structure and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant exhibits a climbing habit, often forming dense thickets in its natural habitat. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in yellowish-green inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
